intro: Phacelia vallis-mortae var. heliophila, commonly known as the sun-loving phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This variety is noted for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its role in supporting pollinator populations.
